Street Singers for Justice NYC

Somebody's Hurting My Brother (click to show/hide lyrics)

by Yara Allen

Somebody's hurting my brother

And it's gone on far too long

Yes it's gone on far too long

I tell you it's gone on far too long

Somebody's hurting my brother

And it's gone on far too long

And we won't be silent any more!

Somebody's taking our Freedom

Singing For Our Lives (click to show/hide lyrics)

by Holly Near

We are a gentle angry people

And we are singing, singing for our lives

We won't let them take our neighbors

This Joy (click to show/hide lyrics)

by Resistance Revival Chorus

This joy that I have

The world didn't give it to me

The world didn't give it to me

The world didn't give it to me

The world didn't give it, the world can't take it away

This love that I have

The world didn't give it to me

This Little Light of Mine (click to show/hide lyrics)

by Traditional spiritual, adapted for justice

This little light of mine

I'm gonna let it shine

I'm gonna let it shine

I'm gonna let it shine

Let it shine

Let it shine

Let it shine

Everywhere I go

I'm gonna let it shine

We Get There Together (click to show/hide lyrics)

by Joshua Blaine

No one is getting left behind this time

No one is getting left behind

No one is getting left behind this time

We get there together or we never get there at all

We get there together or we never get there at all

We get there together or we never get there at all

We Shall Not Be Moved (click to show/hide lyrics)

by Traditional spiritual, adapted for justice

We shall not, we shall not be moved

We shall not, we shall not be moved

Just like a tree that's planted by the water

We shall not be moved

We're fighting for justice

We Shall Overcome (click to show/hide lyrics)

by Traditional spiritual, adapted for civil rights

We shall overcome

We shall overcome

We shall overcome someday

Oh, deep in my heart

I do believe

We shall overcome someday

We are not afraid

Woke Up This Morning (click to show/hide lyrics)

by Traditional spiritual, adapted by Rev. Robert Osby

Woke up this morning with my mind

Stayed on Freedom!

Woke up this morning with my mind

Stayed on Freedom!

Woke up this morning with my mind

Stayed on Freedom!

Hallelu, Hallelu, Hallelujah!

Marchin' and singin' with my mind
